title: Barlborough Pebley Reservoir Walking Route

images.title: Pebley Reservoir was used to water the Chesterfield Canal by SMJ, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Pebley Reservoir

images.title: David Morris / Pebley Pond
images.caption: Pebley Pond. Pebley Pond, alongside the A618 was one of a network of ponds and reservoirs built to supply water to the Chesterfield Canal. Water flows from Pebley down through Harthill Reservoir and into the canal at SK4982, west of the old Norwood Tunnel. This is the local high point of the canal (makes sense really), because to the East it drops down towards Killamarsh and to the West towards Worksop. The pond is stocked and can be fished on a day ticket.

images.title: Nikki Mahadevan / Footpath through the estate of Barlborough Hall
images.caption: Footpath through the estate of Barlborough Hall. The footpath, which followed Ward Lane from the village of Barlborough, continues over the 320 acre Barlborough Hall estate.

images.title: Alan Heardman / Footpath near Barlborough Hall School
images.caption: Footpath near Barlborough Hall School

images.title: John Poyser / Barlborough Hall
images.caption: Barlborough Hall. This fine old building was once part of Mount St Mary's R C College at nearby Spinkhill.

images.title: Neil Theasby / Pub and village cross in Barlborough
images.caption: Pub and village cross in Barlborough

images.title: Harthill Reservoir by Andrew Hill, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Harthill Reservoir 1

description: This walk visits Pebley Reservoir and Harthill Reservoir from the Derbyshire village of Barlborough. Starting from the village you can follow a footpath north along Ward Lane to Barlborough Hall before turning north east towards Pebley Reservoir. The lake is good for wildlife with ducks, swans, geese and egrets to look out for on the walk. Just to the north of here there's Harthill Reservoir where there's some nice waterside trails to try. Near here you can pick up the circular Five Churches Walk which visits five historic churches in South Rotherham .
